analyzed: udāna
translated: The Collection of Spontaneous Utterances .
The First Awakening

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—🔽ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā uruvelāyaṁ viharati najjā nerañjarāya tīre bodhirukkhamūle paṭhamābhisambuddho.
analyzed: evam me suta  ekam samayam bhagavā uruvelāyam viharati najjā nerañjarāya tīre bodhi rukkha mūle paṭhama abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: Thus have I heard:🔽At one time the Buddha was staying at Uruvelā on the bank of the Nerañjarā River at the root of the Bodhi tree, the tree of awakening, newly awakened.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā sattāhaṁ ekapallaṅkena nisinno hoti vimuttisukhapaṭisaṁvedī.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena bhagavā sattāham eka pallaṅkena nisinnaḥ hoti vimutti sukha paṭisavedī
translated: And for seven days the Buddha sat cross-legged at the root of the Bodhi tree experiencing the bliss of liberation.

original: Atha kho bhagavā tassa sattāhassa accayena tamhā samādhimhā vuṭṭhahitvā rattiyā paṭhamaṁ yāmaṁ paṭiccasamuppādaṁ anulomaṁ sādhukaṁ manasākāsi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tassa sattāhassa accayena tamhā samādhimhā vuṭṭhahitvā rattiyā paṭhamam yāmam paṭiccasamuppādam anulomam sādhukam manasā akāsi
translated: Then, with the passing of seven days, the Buddha came out of that concentration and, during the first watch of the night, he gave close attention to dependent origination in forward order:

original: “Iti imasmiṁ sati idaṁ hoti, imassuppādā idaṁ uppajjati, yadidaṁ—
analyzed: iti imasmin sati idam hoti imassa uppādāḥ idam uppajjati
translated: “When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.

analyzed: avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā
translated: That is, with ignorance as condition, there are (volitional) processes;

analyzed: saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇa  viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpa
translated: with (volitional) processes as condition, consciousness;🔽with consciousness as condition, mind and bodily form;

analyzed: nāma rūpa paccayā
translated: with mind and bodily form as condition, the six sense spheres;

analyzed: saḷāyatana paccayā phasso  phassa paccayā vedanā
translated: with the six sense spheres as condition, contact;🔽with contact as condition, feeling;

analyzed: vedanā paccayā taṇhā  taṇhā paccayā upādāna
translated: with feeling as condition, craving;🔽with craving as condition, attachment;

analyzed: upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ
translated: with attachment as condition, continuation;

analyzed: bhava paccayā jāti
translated: with continuation as condition, birth;

analyzed: jāti paccayā jarā maraṇam soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā sambhavanti
translated: With birth as condition: aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair (all) arise.

analyzed: evam etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayaḥ hoti iti
translated: Such is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, the Lord, having understood this matter, at that time uttered this exalted utterance:

analyzed: yadā have pātubhavanti dhammā
translated: “When the things that lead to purification

analyzed: ātāpinaḥ jhāyataḥ brāhmaṇassa
translated: become clear to the ardent meditating brāhmaṇa,

analyzed: athassa kaṅkhāḥ vapayanti sabbā
translated: then all his doubts are eliminated,

analyzed: yatas pajānāti sa hetu dhammanti
translated: when he knows the thing with a cause.”

analyzed: paṭhama
translated: The first.
